planner.apps module

class planner.apps.PlannerConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]

Bases: AppConfig

Configuration for the Planner Django application.

This class defines metadata and settings for the ‘planner’ app, allowing Django to properly discover and manage it.

Parameters:

  • default_auto_field (str) – Specifies the default primary key field type for models in this app to BigAutoField.

  • name (str) – The Python path to this application, used by Django for discovery and referencing.

default_auto_field = 'django.db.models.BigAutoField'
name = 'planner'

class planner.forms.EventForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)[source]

Bases: ModelForm

Form for creating and updating event info This form based on the Event model and inherits from ~django.forms.ModelForm to generate and create forms. :cvar Meta: Inner class to build and host metadata for the form.

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

Metadata for the event form

Variables:

  • date – Date of the event

  • performance_time_start – Start timeof the performance

  • performance_time_end – End time of the performance

  • venue – Venue for event

  • performer – Name of the performer

  • sound-engineer – Name of the assigned engineer.

fields = ['date', 'performance_time_start', 'performance_time_end', 'venue', 'performer', 'sound_engineer']
model

planner.models module

class planner.models.ContactMessage(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a contact message submitted by a user through a form.

This model stores message content, sender details, creation timestamp, and flags for tracking its read and replied-to status.

Variables:

  • name (str) – The name of the person who sent the message.

  • email (str (EmailField)) – The email address of the sender.

  • message (str (TextField)) – The content of the message.

  • created_at (datetime.datetime) – The date and time when the message was created. Automatically set on creation.

  • is_read (bool) – A boolean flag indicating if the message has been read.

  • replied_to (bool) – A boolean flag indicating if a reply has been sent.

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

class planner.models.Event(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a single event with its booking details and assigned sound engineer.

Variables:

  • date (date) – The date of the event.

  • performance_time_start (time) – The start time of the performance.

  • performance_time_end (time) – The end time of the performance.

  • venue (str) – The name of the venue where the event takes place.

  • performer (str) – The name of the performer for the event.

  • sound_engineer (SoundEngineer) – A foreign key to the SoundEngineer model, representing the assigned sound engineer. Can be null.

  • event_notes (str (TextField)) – Additional notes or details for the event. (Optional)

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

In the example:

    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

class planner.models.SoundEngineer(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a sound engineer who can be assigned to various events.

Variables:

  • name (str) – The unique name of the sound engineer.

  • contact_email (str (EmailField)) – The contact email address of the sound engineer.

  • contact_number (str) – The unique contact number of the sound engineer.

events_as_engineer

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

planner.urls module

planner.views module

planner.views.add_event(request: HttpRequest) → HttpRequest[source]

Handles adding new events to the database.

On a GET request, it displays a blank form. On a POST request, it validates and saves the submitted event details to the database. Requires ‘planner.add_event’ permission.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object (GET or POST).

Returns:

Redirects to the index page on successful save, otherwise renders the ‘add_event.html’ template with the form.

Return type:

HttpRequest

planner.views.conditions_view(request: HttpRequest) → HttpRequest[source]

Displays the terms and conditions of use.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Renders the ‘conditions.html’ template, displaying the conditions.

Return type:

HttpRequest

planner.views.contact_view(request: HttpRequest) → HttpRequest[source]

Handles contact form submissions.

On a POST request, it saves the user’s input from the contact form to the ContactMessage database. On a GET request, it displays a blank form.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object (GET or POST).

Returns:

Redirects to the display_message page on successful submission, otherwise renders the ‘contact.html’ template with the form.

Return type:

HttpRequest

planner.views.delete_view(request: HttpRequest, pk: int) → HttpRequest[source]

Handles deleting an event record from the database.

Fetches the event instance by its primary key (pk). On a POST request, it deletes the record. On a GET request, it displays a confirmation page. Requires ‘planner.delete_view’ permission.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object (GET or POST).

  • pk (int) – The primary key of the Event instance to be deleted.

Returns:

Redirects to the index page after successful deletion, otherwise renders the ‘confirm_delete.html’ template.

Return type:

HttpRequest

planner.views.display_message(request: HttpRequest, pk: int) → HttpRequest[source]

Displays the contents of a submitted contact message.

Retrieves a ContactMessage instance based on its primary key (pk).

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • pk (int) – The primary key of the ContactMessage instance to display.

Returns:

Renders the ‘messages.html’ template, displaying the message.

Return type:

HttpRequest

planner.views.edit_event(request: HttpRequest, pk: int) → HttpRequest[source]

Handles editing existing event records.

Retrieves an event instance based on its primary key (pk). On a POST request, it updates the event details. On a GET request, it displays the form pre-filled with the existing event’s data. Requires ‘planner.edit_event’ permission.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object (GET or POST).

  • pk (int) – The primary key of the Event instance to be edited.

Returns:

Redirects to the index page on successful update, otherwise renders the ‘add_event.html’ template with the form.

Return type:

HttpRequest

planner.views.index(request: HttpRequest) → HttpRequest[source]

Displays the main event schedule for logged-in users.

Events are ordered by date and start time. Superusers see a different template (‘planner.html’) than regular users (‘planner_client.html’).

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

An HTTP response rendering the appropriate schedule HTML page.

Return type:

HttpRequest
